comment: He was a good professor just not my favorite. His class is mandatory because he doesn't post powerpoints online, but lectures weren't bad. He does provide a free online textbook. It was 3 tests, two papers, some discussions. Wasn't bad, it was lockdown but no webcam.

I absolutely loved this professor, and this class! Dr. Mueller is very kind with a passion for his subject and his students. He gives very little homework and his exams are online with no lockdown browser (although the exams are so easy and self explanitory you shouldn't feel the need to cheat anyway.)

Professor was engaging, and let students in class have open minded debates. He provides a textbook so you do not have to pay for one. However the only downside is that even though class is not mandatory, it is the only time you get notes. And he does not post power point slides online unless he cancels class.

I am currently taking his class and its great. He is passionate about what he talks about and even though he rambles, he makes the assignments clear. However, it's important to BE IN class to take notes, he doesnt share powerpoints. Will never forget when he said "Gaslight, Girlboss, Gatekeep" lol
Class is just him lecturing, but not a bad professor. He doesn't post any PowerPoint so you just have your textbook to study. Make sure to read the textbook! He rambles in his lectures.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Mueller is a great professor, however he does not provide study materials, post his notes online, or allow you to photograph his notes, so you must be in class to get the content. Grades were based off few tests, 2 discussion posts, and 2 essays, but he is a good grader. Class is not difficult you just have to read textbook and take notes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: He is very passionate and puts a lot of work into his lectures. He doesn't post the powerpoints, so attendance is necessary. Reading the textbook is important, as there is material on the tests that is not in the lectures and is found in the assigned reading. There are very few assignments, so effort is required to get a good grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Mueller is a terrific choice for the Intro to Soci course, especially for Sociology majors. His tests are either entirely from the (free) textbook he assigns or readings he assigned. This class shouldn't be hard for anyone who has basic individual study skills. As long as you read & take notes on the chapters in the textbook you'll be ok
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Inspirational--Graded by few things

comment:
Very good professor. Invested in his class. Graded on a few papers and tests. Tests are easy, as long as you read the textbook, even if you don't attend class. He grades papers fairly, as long as you have a good understanding of the topic.
Only negative is, doesn't post PowerPoints online for you to study, and it's pretty lecture heavy
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Mueller is a good professor! Especially if you like to take notes, there is a LOT of taking notes. The exams and papers are challenging yes, but this class is not hard to pass as long as you actually try and take it seriously. He will work with you extending due dates if needed. Overall, I've enjoyed his class and learned a lot.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Mueller isn't a bad teacher per se, but he doesn't post his PowerPoints online and won't send them to you even if you miss class due to an emergency. He wants us to take notes on his PowerPoints but goes way too fast and doesn't go back if you missed something. We're not supposed to take pictures of his slides either bc it "distracts him"

Goes through lecture slides extremely quickly and doesn't post his content online or send it to you if you can't make a class. Very few grades and it was just hard to get engaged. Wouldn't recommend if you prefer classes accessible online.

He's not bad at explaining sociology but he's boring. Show up to class and read the textbook, you should be good. He goes through the slides in class fast, prepare to type fast. He doesn't post the notes online so again, go to class. Very test-heavy, barely any discussion posts and no extra credit. It wasn't a hard class but it wasn't enjoyable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: He is clearly passionate about sociology, but he is super strict on deadlines. Attendance isn't required but he doesn't post his lecture slides. The tests are a little confusing because you could argue different answers for some of the questions. Overall he's a nice guy, I just wouldn't take him again unless you're really interested in sociology.
